item.title: Computer Vision
item.description:
​ Topic: An Overview of Computer Vision
Presenter: Kevin Wang​

This lesson gave a basic overview of the computer vision problem space. We discussed historically significant developments including convolutional neural networks, AlexNet, ResNet, and more, and we gave a glimpse at ongoing research.​

You can view a recording of this lesson here.

Supplemental Resources

Lesson slides

item.title: Introduction and Basics of Deep Learning
item.description:
​ Topic: Introduction to AI Research and Basics of Deep Learning
Presenter: Kevin Wang ​

This lesson introduced the format of lessons for the winter 2021 semester, briefly introducing the topics to be presented in the coming weeks. We then gave a high-level overview of neural networks, which form the basis of deep learning and drive much of AI research today. ​

You can view a recording of this lesson here.​

Supplemental Resources

Lesson slides

item.title: Convolutional Neural Networks
item.description:
Topic: Convolutional Neural Networks
Presenter: Kevin Wang

This lesson covered convolutional neural networks, which serve as the backbone for many modern-day deep learning applications. Most commonly, convolutional neural networks are used for vision tasks (although not exclusively).

Supplemental Resources

Slides on CNNs
Slides on Neural Networks
